required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Low-Dose Radiation Therapy for Severe COVID-19 Pneumonia
clinical_study.official_title: Low-Dose Radiation Therapy for Severe COVID-19 Pneumonia: A Multicenter Phase II Prospective Randomized Controlled Study

collaborator.agency: The Affiliated BenQ Hospital of Nanjing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: This phase II trial studies low-dose radiation therapy as a treatment for patients with severe COVID-19 pneumonia to improve clinical status.

detailed_description.textblock:
PRIMARY OBJECTIVE:
I. To compare treatment of severe COVID-19 pneumonia between supportive care and standard of care drug therapies versus supportive care and standard of care drug therapies plus low-dose, whole-lung radiation therapy
OUTLINE:
Patients undergo 1.5Gy of single low-dose radiation therapy. After completion of study treatment, patients are followed up at days 1-7, and 14 after last dose of intervention.

primary_outcome.description: improvement of oxygen saturation in percentage

secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate in beats per minutes
Systolic blood pressure in mm Hg Systolic blood pressure in mm Hg

secondary_outcome.measure: Respirations Respirations Respirations Respirations Respirations Respirations
secondary_outcome.description: Respiratory rate in breaths per minute
Positive end expiratory pressure (PEEP) in cm H20
CT scans with volume of consolidation measured in cubic centimeters

arm_group.description: supportive care and standard of care drug therapies (i.e., glucocorticosteroids, Paxlovid, etc.) plus 1.5Gy single treatment of whole-lung radiation therapy
supportive care and standard of care drug therapies (i.e., glucocorticosteroids, Paxlovid, etc.)

intervention.description: 1.5Gy single treatment of whole-lung radiation therapy
